service: Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud Image Builder provides a one-stop-shop to automate the image management processes. You configure an automated pipeline that creates images for use on AWS. As software updates become available, Image Builder automatically produces a new image based on a customizable schedule and distributes it to stipulated AWS Regions after running tests on it. With the Image Builder, organizations can capture their internal or industry-specific compliance policies as a vetted template that can be consistently applied to every new image. Built-in integration with AWS Organizations provides customers with a centralized way to enforce image distribution and access policies across their AWS accounts and Regions. Image Builder supports multiple image format AMIs on AWS.

operations.CancelImageCreation: CancelImageCreation cancels the creation of Image. This operation may only be used on images in a non-terminal state.
operations.CreateComponent: Creates a new component that can be used to build, validate, test and assess your image.
operations.CreateDistributionConfiguration: Creates a new distribution configuration. Distribution configurations define and configure the outputs of your pipeline.
operations.CreateImage: Creates a new image. This request will create a new image along with all of the configured output resources defined in the distribution configuration.
operations.CreateImagePipeline: Creates a new image pipeline. Image pipelines enable you to automate the creation and distribution of images.
operations.CreateImageRecipe: Creates a new image recipe. Image Recipes defines how images are configured, tested and assessed.
operations.CreateInfrastructureConfiguration: Creates a new infrastructure configuration. An infrastructure configuration defines the environment in which your image will be built and tested.
operations.ImportComponent: Imports a component and transforms its data into a component document.
operations.ListComponentBuildVersions: Returns the list of component build versions for the specified semantic version.
operations.ListComponents: Returns the list of component build versions for the specified semantic version.
operations.ListDistributionConfigurations: Returns a list of distribution configurations.
operations.ListImageBuildVersions: Returns a list of distribution configurations.
operations.ListImagePipelineImages: Returns a list of images created by the specified pipeline.
operations.ListImageRecipes: Returns a list of image recipes.
operations.ListImages: Returns the list of image build versions for the specified semantic version.
operations.ListInfrastructureConfigurations: Returns a list of infrastructure configurations.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Returns the list of tags for the specified resource.
operations.PutComponentPolicy: Applies a policy to a component.
operations.PutImagePolicy: Applies a policy to an image.
operations.PutImageRecipePolicy: Applies a policy to an image recipe.
operations.StartImagePipelineExecution: Manually triggers a pipeline to create an image.
operations.TagResource: Adds a tag to a resource.
operations.UntagResource: Removes a tag from a resource.
operations.UpdateDistributionConfiguration: Updates a new distribution configuration. Distribution configurations define and configure the outputs of your pipeline.
operations.UpdateImagePipeline: Updates a new image pipeline. Image pipelines enable you to automate the creation and distribution of images.
operations.UpdateInfrastructureConfiguration: Updates a new infrastructure configuration. An infrastructure configuration defines the environment in which your image will be built and tested.

AmiDistributionConfiguration.base: Define and configure the outputs AMIs of the pipeline.

refs.ListComponentsRequest$owner: The owner defines whose components you wish to list. By default this request will only show components owned by your account. You may use this field to specify if you wish to view components owned by yourself, Amazon, or those components that have been shared with you by other customers.
refs.ListImageRecipesRequest$owner: The owner defines whose image recipes you wish to list. By default this request will only show image recipes owned by your account. You may use this field to specify if you wish to view image recipes owned by yourself, Amazon, or those image recipes that have been shared with you by other customers.
refs.ListImagesRequest$owner: The owner defines whose images you wish to list. By default this request will only show images owned by your account.
